means: dual phase-locked loop 双锁相环路

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词均表示"单调的，乏味的，厌烦的"之意。
means: dull ： 指缺乏鲜明、吸引力或情趣而显得乏味、沉闷。
tedious ： 侧重指文章、演讲、演出等冗长乏味或环境等单调、沉闷，缺乏活力，使感到不舒服。
monotonous ： 指没有变化、重复单调的。
dreary ： 侧重无趣味的，不活泼的事或思想状态。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词都可表示"愚蠢的，笨的，傻的"之意。
means: foolish ： 一般指人的无头脑、愚蠢，或缺乏常识与判断力，或指行动的愚蠢可笑。
silly ： 口语用词，可和foolish互换，但语气稍强。侧重指人的言行不合常规或不理智，强调单纯、低能和糊涂。
stupid ： 多指人或行为的愚蠢，尤指先天智能低下，或因某种原因失去正常的反应或感觉。有时也可与silly和foolish换用，但语气强，常含贬义。
simple ： 强调头脑简单或缺少智慧。
dull ： 指对问题理解迟钝，缺乏灵敏机智头脑，可能是先下智力低下，也可能因疲倦或健康不佳所致。

word_mean: 浊音的：叩诊时无回响的

sentence.Network_en: The evidence was read out to the court in a dull monotone.
sentence.Network_cn: 证据被当庭呆板地宣读了一遍。

sentence.Network_en: I found the characters very two-dimensional, not to say dull.
sentence.Network_cn: 我觉得那些人物形象即使不说是乏味无聊，至少也是毫无深度。

sentence.Network_en: Broadcast news was accurate and reliable but deadly dull.
sentence.Network_cn: 新闻广播准确可靠但却非常枯燥。

新版新概念第二册　单词表--koflfy ... queue v.排队 dull a.枯燥，无味 artiste n.艺人.

jx.jx_en_mean: cause to be less keenly felt; reduce the intensity or effectiveness of
jx.jx_cn_mean: 减轻…的感觉；削弱…的强度

lj.lj_ly: she'd have to find something to dull the edges of the pain.
lj.lj_ls: 她不得不找东西来缓解疼痛。

means.word_mean: 愚钝的,笨的;不活跃的,呆滞的

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English dol 'stupid', of Germanic origin; related to Dutch dol 'crazy' and German toll 'mad, fantastic, wonderful'

entry.tran: 枯燥无味的;沉闷的;无聊的
entry.def: If you describe someone or something as dull, you mean they are not interesting or exciting.

example.ex: They are both nice people but can be rather dull...
example.tran: 他俩都是好人但非常沉闷。

example.ex: I felt she found me boring and dull...
example.tran: 我觉得她认为我既无趣又沉闷。

entry.def: Someone or something that is dull is not very lively or energetic.

example.ex: The body's natural rhythms mean we all feel dull and sleepy between 1 and 3pm.
example.tran: 人体生物钟会让我们在下午 1 点到 3 点之间感觉没精打采、昏昏欲睡。

entry.def: A dull colour or light is not bright.

example.ex: The stamp was a dull blue colour.

entry.def: You say the weather is dull when it is very cloudy.

entry.tran: （声音）不清晰的，隐约的，低沉的
entry.def: Dull sounds are not very clear or loud.

example.ex: The long whining whistle of a shell was followed by the dull boom of the explosion...
example.tran: 在炮弹长长的哀鸣声呼啸而过之后是隆隆而低沉的爆炸声。

example.ex: The coffin closed with a dull thud.
example.tran: 棺材合上时发出一声闷响。

entry.tran: (感觉)不明显的，不强烈的，隐约的
entry.def: Dull feelings are weak and not intense.

example.ex: The pain, usually a dull ache, gets worse with exercise...
example.tran: 通常不明显的疼痛在运动后会加剧。

example.ex: I realized with a kind of dull shock that I didn't recognize a single name.
example.tran: 我暗自一惊，发现一个名字都不认识。

entry.def: If a knife or blade is dull, it is not sharp.

entry.tran: (使)不强烈;(使)变得无光泽;(使)无生气
entry.def: If something dulls or if it is dulled, it becomes less intense, bright, or lively.

example.ex: Her eyes dulled and she gazed blankly...
example.tran: 她眼神暗淡，呆呆地凝视着。

example.ex: He can dull your senses with facts and figures...
example.tran: 他会用事实和数据蒙蔽你的理智。

means.word_mean: 2. become dull or lusterless in appearance; lose shine or brightness;

sentences.sentence: "the varnished table top dulled with time"

means.word_mean: 3. deaden (a sound or noise), especially by wrapping

sentences.sentence: "Too much cutting dulls the knife's edge"
"Middle age dulled her appetite for travel"
"how dull and dreary the world is"
"fell back into one of her dull moods"

means.word_mean: 2. emitting or reflecting very little light;

sentences.sentence: "dull silver badly in need of a polish"

means.word_mean: 3. being or made softer or less loud or clear;

sentences.sentence: "the dull boom of distant breaking waves"

means.word_mean: 4. so lacking in interest as to cause mental weariness;

sentences.sentence: "the deadening effect of some routine tasks"
"a ho-hum speaker who couldn't capture their attention"
"what an irksome task the writing of long letters is"- Edmund Burke
"the tiresome chirping of a cricket"- Mark Twain

means.word_mean: 5. (of color) very low in saturation; highly diluted;
7. slow to learn or understand; lacking intellectual acuity;

sentences.sentence: "so dense he never understands anything I say to him"
"although dull at classical learning, at mathematics he was uncommonly quick"- Thackeray
"dumb officials make some really dumb decisions"
"he was either normally stupid or being deliberately obtuse"

means.word_mean: 9. not having a sharp edge or point;

sentences.sentence: "the knife was too dull to be of any use"
"so exhausted she was dull to what went on about her"- Willa Cather

means.word_mean: 11. not clear and resonant; sounding as if striking with or against something relatively soft;

auth_sentence.content: It helps to enliven a dull afternoon of cricket.
auth_sentence.res_content: It helps to enliven a dull afternoon of cricket.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It helps to enliven a dull afternoon of cricket.

auth_sentence.content: Maybe you think this sounds a tiny bit dull.
auth_sentence.res_content: Maybe you think this sounds a tiny bit dull.

auth_sentence.res_content: Selection Dependable, durable and in some cases dull.

means.word_mean: 不鲜明的, 不清楚的, 晦暗的

sentences.en: Her shriek was dulled by the loud crash of thunder.
sentences.cn: 她的尖叫声在震耳的雷声中变得低沉了。

means.word_mean: 使晦暗，使不鲜明，使无光泽

sentences.en: The colour of the red flag has been dulled by age.
sentences.cn: 那面红旗因年深日久而褪色了。

means.word_mean: 使麻木；使迟钝，使变得不活泼

sentences.en: The smell from the garbage dulled her appetite.
sentences.cn: 闻到来自垃圾的臭味使她食欲大减。

means.word_mean: 使(兴趣、痛苦等)减少，减轻，削弱

sentences.en: She gave me some medicine to dull the pain.
sentences.cn: 她给了我一些可减轻疼痛的药。

jushi.english: He is a very dull pupil.
All work and no play made Jack a dull boy.
jushi.chinese: 只会学习,不会玩,杰克变成了笨小孩。
